sub_title: Group Product Manager at Booking.com |  Building tech for lives well lived
summary:
I am deeply convinced that the role of user-facing technology is not to be a mere tool but to provide a wiser structure, guide us and inspire us to live the life the way we really want. To proactively nudge us to gain the performance and joy in our lives. To express our humanity in each area of life. To empower lives well lived.

- Group Product Manager at Booking.com - making travel more personal and enjoyable
- Executive Advisor at Veterati - facilitating human mentorship connections at scale using technology
- Founder at Glownet - personalizing mass experience at live events in 28+ countries (global leader, 4.5 years)

Work in between technology and human behaviour? Drop me a message!

education.degree_name: Master in Applied mathematics & Computer science

awards.title: #1 Best Event-Tech Startup
awards.description:
Product built under my leadership was selected as the one of the top cutting-edge solutions for the events industry.

Pitching competition winners were decided by a judging panel of industry experts: Adam Parry, Editor at Event Industry News, Jane Hague, President ISES UK and Head of Corporate Account Development at ExCeL London, and Michael Oakes, Head of Programmes EMEA, The Economist.

http://www.eventindustrynews.co.uk/2014/06/23/can-technology-help-run-winning-event-glownet-evvnt-tixboo-win-event-tech-challenge-pitching-competition/

awards.title: Beta Gamma Sigma Member
awards.description:
Beta Gamma Sigma is the premier honor society recognizing business excellence. Lifetime members of the Society have earned the right to be considered the "Best in Business."

Beta Gamma Sigma is the international honor society serving business programs accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. Membership in Beta Gamma Sigma is the highest recognition a business student anywhere in the world can receive in a business program accredited by AACSB International.

profile_positions.description:
Empowered music festival promoters with the latest RFID / NFC technology, delivering transparency and control. Glownet was a top 3 global provider of integrated cashless & access control technology for live events.

We worked with top clients in the industry including Live Nation, SFX and Spotify. By the time I left we had a proven track record of 250+ successful deployments of our systems in UK, Netherlands, Spain, Ireland, Taiwan, South Africa, New Zealand, Turkey, Malaysia, Italy, Belgium, Australia, Gibraltar, India, Thailand, Dubai, Argentina, Marocco and Portugal.

Using RFID-enabled wristbands and cards we provided cashless payments, access control, rich reporting and insight, staff management, sponsor connect and other services based on our fail-proof systems delivered by our experienced team of event managers.

• I led the product and technology side of the business from the early prototype to 250+ successful deployments of our services across the globe up to the delivery for temporary venues with 800.000+ visits

• With a team of 11 great engineers we've built a network-independent system for cashless and other festival services deployed via mobile Android devices for the unreliable environment of live events combined with integrated pre- and post-event experience

• Our technology stack included 
Platforms: Android, Ruby on Rails, Amazon AWS
Open-source libraries such as Dagger, RxJava, Retrofit, Butterknife, DBFlow in Android
Data: Pentaho ETL, Zapier, Tableau, Zoho Reports
Development: GitHub, JIRA, Jenkins, Travis CI, Readme.io
Monitoring: New Relic, Fabric

We were recognised to be the 1st to successfully deliver a 100% cashless network independent solution to: UK, Netherland and Asian market. 

Our clients include Ultra festivals, Lollapalooza, The Next Web, Sónar and others.
profile_positions.title: Chief Technology Officer & Founder

profile_positions.description:
We create the space where scalable mentorship happen. Powerful and open mentorship conversations between US veterans and amazing mentors create new lives and professional success.

Our product removes emotional barriers and let conversations happen thus leading to lives being transformed. I am so grateful for the army of good people dedicated to veterans success that created the movement around Veterati.

I am advising Veterati founders on 
- evolving the product strategy
- design of key user experiences
- creating new ways of communicating with Veterans, Mentors, business partners and the team

volunteer_experiences.role: Judge at the #1 Russian Business Case Championship
volunteer_experiences.description:
Changellenge is the #1 business case championship league in Russia. Changellenge Cup is the flagship competition judged by experienced managers from companies like BCG, Microsoft, Accenture, SAP, KPMG, EY, Mars, Unilever, Danone, Lukoil Overseas, Gazprom Neft, Strategy Partners and RosExpert.

Evaluated 45 teams of top russian students in 3 business case competitions:
- Changellenge Cup Technical 2017 Final
- Changellenge Cup Technical 2017 Semi-final
- Changellenge Cup Technical 2014 Semi-final
- Changellenge Cup Moscow 2013 Semi-final

I have evaluated 5-15 min pitches prepared by the teams and delivered at the negotiation table environment. After discussing and grading all of the teams on their pitches and Q&A session answers I have provided personal post-pitch feedback to several teams to help them learn business skills and perform better in their careers.
Interviewing candidates for MBA and Master In Management programs of one of the top business schools in Europe
